p: HepG2 cells (6 × 10 4 cells/well) were incubated for 24 h. Then, the medium was removed, and cells were washed with phosphate buffer 3 times. The wells were treated with 2,7-dichlorodihydrofluorescein diacetate (DCFH-DA) (Sigma-Aldrich, Co LLC, USA) and with either quercetin standards or (0.4–2 μg/ml) samples (50–3200 μg/ml). The microplate was incubated (60 min at 37°C). Then, the liquid was removed, and cells were washed by PBS. Finally, free radical initiator solution (AAPH) was added to the wells, and the plate was read on the Polar star omega device [ 9].
